## Course information and metadata
This course has been released as an Open Educational Resource. Below you can find the metadata, including access & reuse information. 

### Description
::: {.callout-note appearance="simple" icon=false}
**Title:** Biodiversity Genomics Europe and SciLifeLab Hi-C Course <br>
**Description:** A course to train researchers in open, sustainable training in laboratory preparation of Hi-C libraries for reference genome sequencing of non-model organisms for BGE partner sequencing centers. <br>
**Type:** Video <br>
**Language:** English <br>
**Keywords:** Hi-C, genomics, biodiversity, sequencing <br>
**Content provider:** SciLifeLab and Biodiversity Genomics Europe consortium <br>
**Date created:** June 9-14, 2024 <br>
**Date published:** August 31, 2025  <br>

### Educational
::: {.callout-note appearance="simple" icon=false}
**Target audience:** Researchers with an interest in starting or continuing with Hi-C technique for non-model organisms in their research. Course streams include introductory, intermediate, and advanced levels. <br>
**Structure and duration:**
Introductory stream - 2h40m video content <br>
Challenging Sample stream - 3h20m video content<br>
AssemblyLink stream - (TBD) <br>
Discussion content - (TBD) <br>
**Expertise/skill level:** Intermediate/Advanced. This course is intended for an audience familiar with labwork and research best practices.
